Events that occurred on 21 August

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1917 - Edith Tolkien writes a letter to her husband before leaving Withernsea for Cheltenham.
1954 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Nevill Coghill.
1957 – Artist John Howe is born.
1961 – An interview with J.R.R. Tolkien ("Den besynnerlige professor Tolkien") is published in Swedish.
1982 – The sixth episode of the new version of the 1981 radio series of The Lord of the Rings is aired on BBC Radio 4.
1986 – The Shaping of Middle-earth is published in the UK.
1992 – Tolkien Centenary Conference, a combination of Oxonmoot 1992 and Mythcon 23, at Keble College, Oxford.
2000 – Mythcon 31 in Hawaii.
2006 – The Oxford Tolkien Conference at Exeter College, Oxford.
2007 – The tenth book of The Lord of the Rings Online: Shadows of Angmar, "The Hidden Hope", is released in North America.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
T.A. 3018:
Gandalf is held captive by Saruman on the pinnacle of Orthanc.
Boromir travels towards Rivendell to ask for counsel.
